comments:
In bottom-up scenario when no server exist and I select Tomcat 5.0.  Hitting 
next on page3 resulted in:

IWAB0213E Error in starting server.
    org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException: Could not save the Tomcat server 
configuration: null.
    at 
org.eclipse.jst.server.tomcat.core.internal.TomcatServer.saveConfiguration
(TomcatServer.java:116)
    at org.eclipse.wst.server.core.internal.ServerWorkingCopy.save
(ServerWorkingCopy.java:223)
    at org.eclipse.wst.server.core.internal.ServerWorkingCopy.saveAll
(ServerWorkingCopy.java:235)
    at org.eclipse.jst.ws.internal.common.ServerUtils.createServer
(ServerUtils.java:284)
    at 
org.eclipse.jst.ws.internal.consumption.command.common.ServerDeployableConfigura
tionCommand.execute(ServerDeployableConfigurationCommand.java:116)
    at 
org.eclipse.wst.command.env.core.fragment.CommandFragmentEngine.runCommand
(CommandFragmentEngine.java:322)

I suspect we are not quite calling the right API to create or start the server.

This problem is easily workarounded by creating a server manually.
Assigning to server tooling as per discussion.

Fixed for all server tools paths & JUnit tests. Please retest since there are 
no steps for reproducing the given Web Service scenario.

The problem with create server still exist in 20050210 I-build.  The steps to 
reproduce is as follow:

1. Install Apache Tomcat 4.1 server.  Make sure this workspace does not have an 
existing server.
2. Create J2EE Web project targetting TC 4.1.
3. Create a simple Echo bean in the Web project.
4. Right-click the Echo bean and select Create Web service.  Hit Finish.

With the 0210 build, the symptom is a bit different.  Rather than getting,

IWAB0213E Error in starting server.
    org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException: Could not save the Tomcat server 
configuration: null.
    at 
org.eclipse.jst.server.tomcat.core.internal.TomcatServer.saveConfiguration
(TomcatServer.java:116)

I'm getting:

Unable to create Server.

I talked to Seng about the create server problem and he said that after Tim 
submitted some fix earlier this week, he is aware that we need to make some 
changes in our code to have create server working properly.  So, I'm 
reassigning back to Chris so that he can apply the patch from Seng to get this 
working.

Seng, assigned to you to develop the required fix. I'll still get notified when 
you attach your patch fix.
